places.name: Nonos

places.address: 3 Granary Square, London N1C 4BH, United Kingdom
places.review_excerpt: I was surprised how good the food was (I tried three appetisers, Mama Mia). Amazing food yet amazing view! Please choose the window seat. You will know what I am saying!

places.address: 1 Granary Square, London N1C 4AA, United Kingdom

places.name: Hoppers Kings Cross
places.address: Unit 3, 4 Pancras Sq, London N1C 4AG, United Kingdom

places.name: Decimo
places.address: 10th Floor, 10 Argyle St, London WC1H 8EG, United Kingdom

places.name: Barrafina Coal Drops Yard
places.address: 27 Coal Drops Yard, London N1C 4AB, United Kingdom

places.name: FIRIN
places.address: 140 York Wy, London N1 0AX, United Kingdom

news.title: Who was St Edmund the Martyr and why do we remember him?
news.description: 20 November is St Edmund’s Day, celebrating the king and martyr who was once the patron saint of England. This is his story.

news.title: NLD talking points: Injury issues, Eze meets Spurs and set-piece kings do battle
news.description: With the 198th north London derby on Sunday, live on Sky Sports, we take a look at the big talking points as Arsenal host Tottenham in one of the fiercest rivalries in British football...

news.title: Camden's rough sleepers rise as temperatures drop
news.description: As the temperature falls, Camden Council's outreach team begins its regular count of rough sleepers.

news.title: Wednesday afternoon Cardinal news and notes
news.description: There are few things in life more precious than a kid in a terrifying bird mask enjoying his first win over UK.

news.title: Today in History: November 18, Robert Blake ordered to pay $30 million in wife’s slaying
news.description: Eight months after Robert Blake was acquitted of murdering his wife at a criminal trial, a civil jury decided the actor was behind the killing and ordered him to pay $30 million to Bonny Lee Bakley’s children.

news.title: Google DeepMind won a Nobel prize for AI: can it produce the next big breakthrough?
news.description: The company was created to use AI for world- changing science — and achieved that with AlphaFold. But the advent of large language models raises deep questions about the future of DeepMind.
